characteristics.description: 1 in every 5 models in this unit can be either a Daemonette Banner Bearer or a Daemonette Icon Bearer.Daemonette Banner Bearer: You can re-roll charge rolls for this unit while it includes any Daemonette Banner Bearers.Daemonette Icon Bearer: If an unmodified battleshock roll of 1 is made for this unit while it includes any Daemonette Icon Bearers, you can add D6 models to this unit and no models from this unit will flee in that phase.

characteristics.name: HORNBLOWER
characteristics.description: 1 in every 10 models in this unit can be a Daemonette Hornblower. If the unmodified roll for a battleshock test for an enemy unit that is within 6" of this unit while this unit includes any Daemonette Hornblowers is 1, that battleshock test must be re-rolled.

abilities.name: Lithe and Swift
abilities.flavorText: Daemonettes surge across the battlefield with impossible swiftness.
abilities.description: This unit can run and still charge later in the same turn.

name: Flesh Hounds
flavorText: Swift, strong, and tenacious beyond mortal reason, Flesh Hounds run their prey to the ground without mercy. Those who seek to trick or destroy these daemonic beasts with sorcery find their powers flickering to nothing, extinguished by the wrath of Khorne.
description: A unit of Flesh Hounds has any number of models, each armed with Blood-dark Claws.

characteristics.name: GORE HOUNDS
characteristics.description: 1 in every 5 models in this unit can be a Gore Hound. That model is armed with a Burning Roar in addition to its other weapons.

abilities.name: Collars of Khorne
abilities.flavorText: Spellcasters have learned to dread Flesh Hounds as much for their collars as for their claws.
abilities.description: This unit can attempt to unbind one spell in the enemy hero phase in the same manner as a WIZARD. In addition, this unit can attempt to dispel one endless spell at the start of your hero phase in the same manner as a WIZARD. Add 1 to unbinding and dispelling rolls for this unit while it contains 10 or more models.

abilities.name: Unflagging Hunters
abilities.flavorText: When blood is scented, nothing will keep a Flesh Hound from its prey.
abilities.description: You can re-roll charge rolls for this unit.

name: Plaguebearers
flavorText: Plaguebearers trudge to battle amidst the drone of flies’ wings and endless counting. These daemons tally the diseases unleashed upon the realms, all the while stabbing and hacking at their enemies with filthy plagueswords.

name: Beasts of Nurgle
flavorText: As stupid as they are enthusiastic, Beasts of Nurgle bound forth with burbles of joy. Huge, slug-like abominations, they gleefully assail their luckless playmates until their joy proves lethal, before bounding off after new victims.

name: Bloodcrushers
flavorText: The ground shakes beneath the onrushing fury of the Bloodcrushers, and with the force of a falling mountain they crash into the enemy. Those not crushed beneath the Juggernauts’ hooves are slain by the swinging hellblades of the beasts’ riders.
description: A unit of Bloodcrushers has any number of models, each armed with a Hellblade.

characteristics.name: MOUNTS
characteristics.description: This unit’s Juggernauts attack with their Brazen Hooves.

characteristics.name: BLOODHUNTER
characteristics.description: 1 model in this unit is a Bloodhunter. Add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of that model’s Hellblade.

characteristics.name: ICON BEARERS
characteristics.description: 1 in every 3 models in this unit can be an Icon Bearer. If an unmodified battleshock roll of 1 is made for this unit while it includes any Icon Bearers, you can add 1 model to this unit, and no models from this unit will flee in that phase.

characteristics.name: HORNBLOWER
characteristics.description: 1 in every 3 models in this unit can be a Hornblower. While this unit includes any Hornblowers, if the unmodified roll for a battleshock test for an enemy unit that is within 8" of this unit is 1, that battleshock test must be re-rolled.

abilities.name: Decapitating Blow
abilities.flavorText: There are few weapons so feared as the hellforged blades of the Bloodletters.
abilities.description: If the unmodified hit roll for an attack made with a Hellblade is 6, that attack inflicts 1 mortal wound on the target in addition to any normal damage.

abilities.name: Murderous Charge
abilities.flavorText: The crushing mass and stamping hooves of Khorne’s Juggernauts are a threat to all in their path.
abilities.description: After a model in this unit makes a charge move, you can pick 1 enemy unit within 1" of that model and roll a dice. On a 2+ that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound. If this unit has more than 1 model, roll to determine if mortal wounds are inflicted after each model completes its charge move, but do not allocate the mortal wounds until after all of the models in the unit have moved. If this unit has 6 or more models when it makes a charge move, change the mortal wounds inflicted by this ability from 1 to D3.

name: Burning Chariots of Tzeentch
flavorText: Drawn through the skies by a pair of Screamers, a Burning Chariot rides upon a wave of multicoloured flames that scorches all in its wake, while the Exalted Flamer that writhes and twists upon its back breathes out sheets of unnatural, billowing fire.
description: A unit of Burning Chariots of Tzeentch has any number of models, each armed with Billowing Warpflame, Flaming Maws and Blue Horror’s Jabs.

characteristics.name: MOUNT
characteristics.description: This unit’s Screamers of Tzeentch attack with their Lamprey Bites.

characteristics.name: FLY
characteristics.description: This unit can fly.

characteristics.name: CHAMPION
characteristics.description: If this unit has 3 or more models, 1 model in this unit can be a champion.

abilities.name: Capricious Warpflame
abilities.flavorText: These unnatural fires continue to burn long after they meet their target, clawing at the nearest foe as a Fury would its prey.
abilities.description: Add 1 to hit rolls for attacks made by this unit if the target unit has 10 or more models.

abilities.name: Sky-sharks
abilities.flavorText: Screamers that manage to sink their teeth into a larger creature will not let go easily, eventually tearing off huge chunks of bloodied flesh.
abilities.description: If the target is an enemy MONSTER, change the Damage characteristic of this unit’s Lamprey Bite to D3.

abilities.name: Touched by Fire
abilities.flavorText: When forced to meet an enemy in hand-to-hand combat, Flamers rely on their blazing forms to repel their foe.
abilities.description: Roll a dice each time you allocate a wound or mortal wound to this unit that was inflicted by a melee weapon. On a 5+, the attacking unit suffers 1 mortal wound.

abilities.name: Wake of Fire
abilities.flavorText: Enemies unfortunate enough to be passed by a Burning Chariot are flooded with waves of unnatural fire.
abilities.description: After this unit has made a normal move, you can pick 1 enemy unit that has any models passed across by any models from this unit and roll a dice. On a 2+, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds.

pitchedBattleNotes: Herald of Tzeentch on Burning Chariot

name: Exalted Chariot
flavorText: The massive chariots ridden by Allurers of the highest rank are machines that embody excess. Their purpose is to bring to bear the most number of blades in the shortest time, and hence fill the air with the scent of carnage.
description: An Exalted Chariot is a single model commanded by an Allurer, who is armed with Flensing Whips.

characteristics.name: CREW AND STEEDS
characteristics.description: An Exalted Chariot has a Daemonette crew armed with Piercing Claws, and is drawn by Steeds of Slaanesh that attack with their Poisoned Tongues. For rules purposes, the Daemonettes and Steeds of Slaanesh are treated in the same manner as a mount.

abilities.name: Excess of Blades
abilities.flavorText: An Exalted Chariot inflicts horrendous carnage when it ploughs into the foe.
abilities.description: After this model finishes a charge move, roll a dice for each enemy unit that is within 1" of it. On a 1, nothing happens. On a 2-4, that unit suffers D3 mortal wounds. On a 5+, that unit suffers D6 mortal wounds.

abilities.name: Pungent Soulscent
abilities.flavorText: The whirling blades of this fearsome chariot mow down the enemy, transmuting their souls into an exhilarating incense that drives its riders into an ecstatic frenzy.
abilities.description: At the start of the combat phase, roll a dice for each enemy unit within 1" of this model. On a 2+, that unit suffers D3 mortal wounds. In addition, for each 2+, add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of this model’s melee weapons until the end of that phase.

name: Exalted Flamers of Tzeentch
flavorText: An Exalted Flamer can project gouts of multicoloured flame, turning entire enemy units into piles of blackened bones. The shifting warpflames seem to have a mind of their own, forming hideous faces and ominous sigils with their tongues of fire.
description: A unit of Exalted Flamers of Tzeentch has any number of models, each armed with Billowing Warpflame and Flaming Maws.

characteristics.name: FLY
characteristics.description: This unit can fly.

characteristics.name: ELITE
characteristics.description: Models in this unit can issue commands to their own unit.

abilities.name: Capricious Warpflame
abilities.flavorText: These unnatural fires continue to burn long after they meet their target, clawing at the nearest foe as a Fury would its prey.
abilities.description: Add 1 to hit rolls for attacks made by this unit if the target unit has 10 or more models.

abilities.name: Touched by Fire
abilities.flavorText: When forced to meet an enemy in hand-to-hand combat, Flamers rely on their blazing forms to repel their foe.
abilities.description: Roll a dice each time you allocate a wound or mortal wound to this unit that was inflicted by a melee weapon. On a 5+, the attacking unit suffers 1 mortal wound.

name: Fiends
flavorText: Horrific nightmares given bestial shape, Fiends of Slaanesh emit a harsh, trilling call as they race towards their prey. A dream-inducing scent hangs thick around the Fiends, reducing their foes to a stupor and sapping them of their will to fight.
description: A unit of Fiends has any number of models, each armed with Deadly Pincers and a Barbed Stinger.

characteristics.name: BLISSBRINGER
characteristics.description: 1 model in this unit can be a Blissbringer. Add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of that model’s Deadly Pincers.

abilities.name: Crushing Grip
abilities.flavorText: A Fiend’s pincers are capable of inflicting immense damage on a victim that is caught in their grasp.
abilities.description: If the unmodified wound roll for an attack made with Deadly Pincers is 6, that weapon has a Damage characteristic of D3 instead of 1 for that attack.

abilities.name: Deadly Venom
abilities.flavorText: A Fiend’s stinger is laced with venom capable of sending any foe into a deep coma.
abilities.description: If the target of an attack made with a Barbed Stinger has a Wounds characteristic of 1, that weapon has a Damage characteristic of 1 for that attack. If the target of an attack made with a Barbed Stinger has a Wounds characteristic of 2-3, that weapon has a Damage characteristic of D3 for that attack. If the target of an attack made with a Barbed Stinger has a Wounds characteristic of 4 or more, that weapon has a Damage characteristic of D6 for that attack.

abilities.name: Disruptive Song
abilities.flavorText: Fiends of Slaanesh let out a keening song that disturbs the concentration of spellcasters who hear it.
abilities.description: Subtract 1 from casting rolls for enemy WIZARDS while they are within 12" of any friendly models with this ability.

abilities.name: Soporific Musk
abilities.flavorText: A Fiend exudes a pervasive and oily musk that numbs a foe to all but the most extreme of stimuli.
abilities.description: Subtract 1 from hit rolls for attacks made with melee weapons that target this unit. In addition, while this unit has 4 or more models, subtract 1 from wound rolls for attacks made with melee weapons that target this unit.

name: Flamers of Tzeentch
flavorText: Bounding in a disturbing fashion, Flamers of Tzeentch spring towards the foe spouting the warpfires of Chaos. Yet the Changer of the Ways is fickle, and fires that have burnt out may once more leap to life, guiding even more flames to the target.
description: A unit of Flamers of Tzeentch has any number of models, each armed with Warpflame and Flaming Maws.

characteristics.name: PYROCASTER
characteristics.description: 1 model in this unit can be a Pyrocaster. Add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of that model’s missile weapon.

characteristics.name: FLY
characteristics.description: This unit can fly.

abilities.name: Capricious Warpflame
abilities.flavorText: These unnatural fires continue to burn long after they meet their target, clawing at the nearest foe as a Fury would its prey.
abilities.description: Add 1 to hit rolls for attacks made by this unit if the target unit has 10 or more models.

abilities.name: Touched by Fire
abilities.flavorText: When forced to meet an enemy in hand-to-hand combat, Flamers rely on their blazing forms to repel their foe.
abilities.description: Roll a dice each time you allocate a wound or mortal wound to this unit that was inflicted by a melee weapon. On a 5+, the attacking unit suffers 1 mortal wound.

name: Furies
flavorText: Furies are spiteful daemonic imps that throng those lands under the sway of Chaos. Though individually weak, when they swarm they can prove surprisingly deadly, waiting until the foe’s back is turned before launching vicious hit-and-run attacks.
description: A unit of Furies has any number of models, each armed with a Razor-sharp Dagger and Claws.

characteristics.name: FLY
characteristics.description: This unit can fly.

abilities.name: Sneaky Little Devils
abilities.flavorText: Furies are spiteful creatures that utterly loathe the idea of engaging in a fair fight, much preferring – where possible – to stab distracted enemies in the back.
abilities.description: In the combat phase, when you pick this unit to fight, you can say it will cower instead of fighting. If you do so, this unit must retreat.

name: Hellflayer
flavorText: Hellflayer chariots drive through the meadows of Slaanesh’s realm, dismembering those cursed to lie there in purgatory. On the battlefields of the Mortal Realms, they are roving weapons of war, their many scythes delivering death by a thousand cuts.
description: A Hellflayer is a single model commanded by an Allurer, who is armed with Piercing Claws.

characteristics.name: CREW AND STEEDS
characteristics.description: A Hellflayer has a Daemonette crew armed with Piercing Claws and Flensing Whips, and is drawn by Steeds of Slaanesh that attack with their Poisoned Tongues. For rules purposes, the Daemonettes and Steeds of Slaanesh are treated in the same manner as a mount.

abilities.name: Soulscent
abilities.flavorText: The whirling blades of this fearsome chariot mow down the enemy, transmuting their souls into an exhilarating incense.
abilities.description: At the start of the combat phase, roll a dice for each enemy unit within 1" of this model. On a 4+, that unit suffers D3 mortal wounds. In addition, for each 4+, add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of this model’s melee weapons until the end of that phase.

name: Horrors of Tzeentch
flavorText: Gibbering with lunatic energy, the luminescent Pink Horrors whirl and flail, generating raw magic that can manifest as blasts of unnatural fire that scour the enemy. Should they be slain, Horrors split in twain to form two lesser incarnations.
pitchedBattleNotes: Battleline if the unit contains no Blue Horrors and no Brimstone Horrors. If the unit contains no Pink Horrors
change the points cost to 150. If the unit contains no Pink Horrors and no Blue Horrors

name: Karanak
flavorText: Ever watchful, ever hungry, Karanak is the physical manifestation of the Blood God’s wrathful vengeance. Once he has the scent of his quarry, this tireless hunter will not cease in his hunt until he tastes their torn flesh between his fangs.
description: Karanak is a named character that is a single model. He is armed with Gore-slick Claws and Three Savage Maws.

abilities.name: Unflagging Hunter
abilities.flavorText: Karanak bounds towards the foe, hungry for the taste of living flesh.
abilities.description: You can re-roll charge rolls for this model.

abilities.name: Brass Collar of Bloody Vengeance
abilities.flavorText: Wizards tremble wherever Karanak prowls.
abilities.description: This model can attempt to unbind one spell in the enemy hero phase in the same manner as a WIZARD. In addition, this model can attempt to dispel one endless spell at the start of your hero phase in the same manner as a WIZARD. If this model successfully unbinds a spell or dispels an endless spell, the caster suffers D3 mortal wounds.

abilities.name: Prey of the Blood God
abilities.flavorText: Karanak is a tireless hunter, hungering for his chosen quarry’s flesh.
abilities.description: After armies are set up, but before the first battle round begins, pick 1 enemy HERO to be this model’s quarry. You can re-roll hit and wound rolls for attacks made by this model that target that HERO.

abilities.name: Call of the HuntPrey of the Blood God
abilities.flavorText: With a primal call, Karanak summons slathering Flesh Hounds to the feast.
abilities.description: Call of the Hunt: Once per game, during the hero phase, you can summon 1 unit of 5 Flesh Hounds to the battlefield and add it to your army if this model is within 8" of its quarry (see Prey of the Blood God). The summoned unit must be set up wholly within 8" of this model and more than 9" from any enemy units. The summoned unit cannot move in the following movement phase.

name: Nurglings
flavorText: Nurglings are daemon mites that tumble from the innards of larger daemons or spill up from sewers and fissures in reality. They pour across the battlefield in a stinking tide, burying the foe beneath waves of infectious foulness.

name: Plague Drones
flavorText: Plague Drones are high-ranking Plaguebearers who travel atop Rot Flies. These daemonic mounts attack with their toxic stingers and foul mouthparts, while their riders hurl death’s heads projectiles that explode in showers of filth.

name: Riptooth
flavorText: Perhaps the greatest of the Lord of Battle’s gifts to Magore Redhand is the Flesh Hound Riptooth. A vicious hunter and loyal companion, he has chased down his master’s prey and warded off enemy sorcery on battlefields beyond count.
description: Riptooth is a single model. He tears his victims to pieces with his Blood-dark Claws.

abilities.name: Collar of Khorne
abilities.flavorText: Spellcasters have learned to dread Flesh Hounds as much for their collars as for their claws.
abilities.description: This unit can attempt to unbind one spell in the enemy hero phase in the same manner as a WIZARD. In addition, this unit can attempt to dispel one endless spell at the start of your hero phase in the same manner as a WIZARD.

abilities.name: Unflagging Hunter
abilities.flavorText: When blood is scented, nothing will keep a Flesh Hound from its prey.
abilities.description: You can re-roll charge rolls for this model.

pitchedBattleNotes: Unique. Riptooth and Magore’s Fiends must be taken as a set. Although taken as a set

name: Screamers of Tzeentch
flavorText: Speeding blurs that leave shimmering trails of change-magic in the air, Screamers streak across the skies with a wailing cry. They slash any foes they pass with razorsharp horns and fins before darting down to savage their chosen quarry.
description: A unit of Screamers of Tzeentch has any number of models, each attacking with a Lamprey Bite.

characteristics.name: FLY
characteristics.description: This unit can fly.

abilities.name: Sky-sharks
abilities.flavorText: Screamers that manage to sink their teeth into a larger creature will not let go easily, eventually tearing off huge chunks of bloodied flesh.
abilities.description: If the target is an enemy MONSTER, change the Damage characteristic of this unit’s Lamprey Bite to D3.

abilities.name: Slashing Fins
abilities.flavorText: The pack mentality of Screamers makes them an especially effective unit on the battlefield. They swoop in formation and slash at their foes, performing fly-by attacks and effortless manoeuvres.
abilities.description: After this unit has made a normal move, pick 1 enemy unit and roll 1 dice for each model in this unit that passed across any models from that unit. For each 5+, that unit suffers 1 mortal wound. If that enemy unit is a WIZARD, for each 5+, inflict D3 mortal wounds instead of 1.

name: Seeker Chariots
flavorText: Seeker Chariots lead the charge of many Hedonite armies, for the beasts that pull them to war are as fleet-footed as Aqshian cheetahs. Whips lash out to strip flesh from bone as the Allurer drives the blade-wheeled conveyance into the thick of the foe.
description: A unit of Seeker Chariots has any number of models, each commanded by an Allurer armed with Flensing Whips.

characteristics.name: CREW AND STEEDS
characteristics.description: A Seeker Chariot has a Daemonette crew armed with Piercing Claws, and is drawn by Steeds of Slaanesh that attack with their Poisoned Tongues. For rules purposes, the Daemonette and Steeds of Slaanesh are treated in the same manner as a mount.

abilities.name: Impossibly Swift
abilities.flavorText: Seeker Chariots surge across the battlefield with unnatural swiftness.
abilities.description: This unit can retreat and still charge later in the same turn.

abilities.name: Mutilating Blades
abilities.flavorText: A Seeker Chariot inflicts carnage when it ploughs into the foe.
abilities.description: After a model from this unit finishes a charge move, roll a dice for each enemy unit within 1" of that model. On a 2+, that unit suffers D3 mortal wounds. If this unit has more than 1 model, roll to determine if mortal wounds are inflicted after each model finishes its charge move, but do not allocate the mortal wounds until all of the models in the unit have finished their charge moves.

name: Seekers
flavorText: The Seekers of Slaanesh are the vanguard of the Dark Prince’s daemon armies, insatiable outriders who track their foes with unrelenting swiftness, feeding on the growing terror of their prey.
description: A unit of Seekers has any number of models, each armed with Piercing Claws.

characteristics.name: MOUNT
characteristics.description: This unit’s Steeds of Slaanesh attack with their Poisoned Tongues.

characteristics.name: HEARTSEEKER
characteristics.description: 1 model in this unit can be a Heartseeker. Add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of that model’s Piercing Claws.

characteristics.name: STANDARD BEARERS
characteristics.description: 1 in every 5 models in this unit can be a Seeker Banner Bearer, and 1 in every 5 models in this unit can be a Seeker Icon Bearer.Seeker Banner Bearer: You can re-roll charge rolls for this unit while it includes any Seeker Banner Bearers.Seeker Icon Bearer: If an unmodified battleshock roll of 1 is made for this unit while it includes any Seeker Icon Bearers, you can add D3 models to this unit and no models from this unit will flee in that phase.

characteristics.name: HORNBLOWER
characteristics.description: 1 in every 5 models in this unit can be a Seeker Hornblower. If the unmodified roll for a battleshock test for an enemy unit that is within 6" of this unit while this unit includes any Seeker Hornblowers is 1, that battleshock test must be re-rolled.

abilities.name: Quicksilver Speed
abilities.flavorText: Seekers of Slaanesh are daemonic hunters, and swift beyond belief.
abilities.description: You can roll 2D6 instead of D6 when you make a run roll for this unit. In addition, this unit can run and still charge later in the same turn.

abilities.name: Soul Hunters
abilities.flavorText: Slaanesh rewards his Seekers with intoxicating energy when they slay his foes.
abilities.description: If any enemy models were slain by wounds inflicted by this unit’s attacks in the combat phase, add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of this unit’s melee weapons in the following combat phase.

name: Soul Grinder
flavorText: There is no act of destruction a Soul Grinder will not commit in an effort to complete the tithe of death demanded from it. These clanking daemon engines scuttle forth on huge mechanical legs, unable to rest while a single foe draws breath.
description: A Soul Grinder is a single model armed with a Harvester Cannon, Phlegm Bombardment, Hellforged Claw, Piston-driven Legs and one of the following weapon options: Warpmetal Blade; or Daemonbone Talon.

characteristics.name: MARK OF CHAOS
characteristics.description: When you select this model to be part of your army, you must give it one of the following Mark of Chaos keywords: KHORNE, TZEENTCH, NURGLE, SLAANESH or UNDIVIDED.

abilities.name: Hellforged Claw
abilities.flavorText: The crushing force of a Hellforged Claw can obliterate anything unfortunate enough to be caught in its grasp.
abilities.description: If the unmodified hit roll for an attack made with a Hellforged Claw is 6, that attack inflicts D6 mortal wounds on the target and the attack sequence ends (do not make a wound or save roll).

abilities.name: Implacable Advance
abilities.flavorText: This daemonic engine is utterly relentless in its desire to pay off the soultithe owed to its masters.
abilities.description: This model can run and still shoot later in the same turn.

name: Mazarall the Butcher
flavorText: Mazarall the Butcher is a renderer of mortal flesh and a devourer of daemons both. His sheer barbarity and unbridled rage have led many to believe him more mindless beast than canny warlord, but such a belief is a mistake for which many have lost their lives.
description: Mazarall the Butcher is armed with the Ancyte Shield’s Wrath, the Ancyte Shield’s Blades and Harrow Meat.

abilities.name: Bloody Charge
abilities.flavorText: A towering creature of muscle and rage, Mazarall barrels into his foes, throwing aside bodies with contemptuous ease.
abilities.description: Roll a dice for each enemy unit that is within 1" of this model after this model makes a charge move. On a 4+ that unit suffers D3 mortal wounds.

abilities.name: Harrow Meat’s Hunger
abilities.flavorText: Harrow Meat, Mazarall’s infamous axe, possesses its own crude sentience, fuelling Mazarall’s fury with each drop of blood fed to it.
abilities.description: At the end of the combat phase, if any enemy models were slain by wounds inflicted by this model’s attacks in that combat phase, add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of Harrow Meat for the rest of the battle.

abilities.name: The Ancyte Shield
abilities.flavorText: Covered in the stretched skin of unfortunate spellcasters, the Ancyte Shield serves as protection against hateful magic.
abilities.description: This model can attempt to unbind 1 spell in the enemy hero phase in the same manner as a WIZARD.

abilities.name: The Butcher’s Due
abilities.flavorText: To follow Mazarall is to tread the path of ascension on a road paved with the butchered carcasses of the dead.
abilities.description: You can use this command ability at the start of the combat phase. The command must be issued by this model and received by a friendly KHORNE unit. Add 1 to wound rolls for attacks made by that unit until the end of that phase.

name: Skull Cannons
flavorText: The hideous war machines known as Skull Cannons vomit forth barrages of skulls amidst blasts of sulphurous smoke and flame, their macabre ordnance screaming through the skies before exploding with murderous fury amongst the enemy ranks.
description: A unit of Skull Cannons has any number of models, each armed with Burning Skulls and a Gnashing Maw.

characteristics.name: CREW
characteristics.description: This model has a Bloodletter crew that attack with their Hellblades. For rules purposes, the crew are treated in the same manner as a mount.

abilities.name: Burning Skulls
abilities.flavorText: Foes massed together offer an easy target for a Skull Cannon’s flaming projectiles.
abilities.description: Add 1 to hit rolls for attacks made with this unit’s Burning Skulls if the target unit contains 10 or more models.

abilities.name: Grind their Bones, Seize their Skulls
abilities.flavorText: Enemies seized by a Skull Cannon’s jaws are used to power the infernal machine, their skulls taken and used as fiery munitions.
abilities.description: After this unit attacks for the first time in each combat phase, if any enemy models were slain by this unit’s attacks, this unit can attack with all of the missile weapons it is armed with.

abilities.name: Decapitating Blow
abilities.flavorText: There are few weapons so feared as the hellforged blades of the Bloodletters.
abilities.description: If the unmodified hit roll for an attack made with Hellblades is 6, that attack inflicts 1 mortal wound on the target in addition to any normal damage.
